# STORAGE ACCOUNT (from Linked service name)
storage_account = "pinsstodwdevuks9h80mb"

# CONTAINER (top-level folder under the storage account)
container = "horizon-migration-poc"

# FOLDER where LLAttrData.csv lives
folder = "MPESC-EXTRACT"

# INPUT FILE
input_file = "LLAttrData.csv"

# OUTPUT FOLDER (already exists â€“ good)
output_folder = "LLAttr"

output_folder   = "LLAttr"                 # you want tables to land inside this folder

input_path  = f"abfss://{container}@{storage_account}.dfs.core.windows.net/{folder}/{input_file}"
output_base = f"abfss://{container}@{storage_account}.dfs.core.windows.net/{folder}/{output_folder}"

print("INPUT :", input_path)
print("OUTPUT:", output_base)

df_raw = (
    spark.read
    .option("header", True)
    .option("inferSchema", False)   # keep as strings first (safer for big messy CSVs)
    .option("multiLine", False)
    .option("escape", '"')
    .option("quote", '"')
    .csv(input_path)
)

print("Rows:", df_raw.count())
print("Cols:", len(df_raw.columns))
df_raw.printSchema()
df_raw.show(5, truncate=False)

from pyspark.sql import functions as F

# quick glance at key columns
df_raw.select("DefID","AttrID","KeyID","EntryNum","ParentKeyID").show(10, truncate=False)

# distinct DefIDs
df_raw.select("DefID").distinct().orderBy("DefID").show(50, truncate=False)

dfv = (
    df.withColumn(
        "Value",
        F.coalesce(
            F.col("ValStr").cast("string"),
            F.col("ValLong").cast("string"),
            F.col("ValDate").cast("string"),
            F.col("ValReal").cast("string"),
            F.col("ValInt").cast("string"),
        )
    )
    .withColumn("Value", F.when(F.trim(F.col("Value")) == "", None).otherwise(F.col("Value")))
)

dfv.select("DefID","AttrID","KeyID","EntryNum","ParentKeyID","Value","ValInt","ValReal","ValDate","ValStr","ValLong").show(20, truncate=False)

from pyspark.sql import functions as F

dfv_nonnull = (
    df
    .withColumn(
        "Value",
        F.coalesce(
            F.col("ValStr").cast("string"),
            F.col("ValLong").cast("string"),
            F.col("ValDate").cast("string"),
            F.col("ValReal").cast("string"),
            F.col("ValInt").cast("string"),
        )
    )
    .withColumn("Value", F.when(F.trim(F.col("Value")) == "", None).otherwise(F.col("Value")))
    .filter(F.col("Value").isNotNull())
)

print("Rows with Value:", dfv_nonnull.count())
dfv_nonnull.select("DefID","AttrID","KeyID","EntryNum","ParentKeyID","Value").show(10, truncate=False)

test_defid = 12361638

df_test = dfv_nonnull.filter(F.col("DefID") == test_defid)

print("Rows for DefID", test_defid, ":", df_test.count())

df_test.select(
    "DefID","AttrID","KeyID","EntryNum","ParentKeyID","Value"
).show(30, truncate=False)

# What attributes exist for this table?
df_test.select("AttrID").distinct().orderBy("AttrID").show(200, truncate=False)

pivot_index = ["DefID", "KeyID", "ParentKeyID", "EntryNum", "CustomID"]

df_pivot = (
    df_test
    .select(*(pivot_index + ["AttrID","Value"]))
    .groupBy(*pivot_index)
    .pivot("AttrID")
    .agg(F.first("Value"))
)

print("Pivot rows:", df_pivot.count())
print("Pivot cols:", len(df_pivot.columns))
df_pivot.show(10, truncate=False)

out_path = f"{output_base}/DefID={test_defid}"

(
    df_pivot
    .repartition(1)   # makes one csv file; remove later for big scale
    .write.mode("overwrite")
    .option("header", True)
    .csv(out_path)
)

print("Wrote:", out_path)

from pyspark.sql import functions as F

dfv_nonnull.filter(F.col("DefID").isNull()).select("DefID","AttrID","KeyID","Value").show(20, truncate=False)
print("Null DefID rows:", dfv_nonnull.filter(F.col("DefID").isNull()).count())

defids = [r["DefID"] for r in dfv_nonnull.select("DefID").distinct().collect()]
print("DefIDs found:", len(defids))

for d in sorted(defids):
    df_d = dfv_nonnull.filter(F.col("DefID") == d)

    df_p = (
        df_d.select("DefID","KeyID","ParentKeyID","EntryNum","CustomID","AttrID","Value")
            .groupBy("DefID","KeyID","ParentKeyID","EntryNum","CustomID")
            .pivot("AttrID")
            .agg(F.first("Value"))
    )

    out = f"{output_base}/DefID={d}"
    (df_p.write.mode("overwrite").option("header", True).csv(out))
    print("Wrote:", out)
